section.p: This chapter is a quick review of the mathematical prerequisities for MATH 2150: manipulating numbers, overcoming mistakes, setting up coordinate systems, and solving simultaneous equations.

This material will not be directly examined, but I've included it regardless. It seems wise to remember what's good after the reader (and myself included) perhaps did not spend the summer doing mathematics.
You are free to initially skim this material, then loop back to it at any time during the semester. Perhaps you'll want to test yourself against some of the inline exercises, which look like:
